data.title: A Hearts Desire
data.meta_description: "A Hearts Desire" is the thirteenth episode and season finale of Disventure Camp (season 1). It premiered on November 30, 2023, on the official YouTube channel from Odd Nation Cartoons. The finale is here, and the three finalists are hungry for the million dollar prize. One finalist would win...
data.text:
This article/section contains spoilers, continue reading at your own risk.

"A Hearts Desire" is the thirteenth episode and season finale of Disventure Camp (season 1). It premiered on November 30, 2023, on the official YouTube channel from Odd Nation Cartoons.

Synopsis

The finale is here, and the three finalists are hungry for the million dollar prize. One finalist would win over the support of many, while one would receive no support at all, with only one cheering them on after being forced to choose. The finalists all get to choose a helper. After the helpers are assigned, a couple is reunited, and two schemers put aside their conflict, while working with two good friends. One contestant would take third place because of a test of morality from another. And with the final two set, a sabotage mark gone wrong would make one contestant finally receive their karma while another receives praise for winning the season. Two individuals face punishment for their crimes, while one attempts to flee the scene with the winner's prize money, only for his greatest foe to finally confront him and prevent the burglary.

Story

The episode opens with Derek and Trevor welcoming the viewers. Derek reveals they allowed the finalists some time to say a few words before the final challenge.

Trevor reveals they've interviewed the eliminated campers so they could share their experiences.

Trevor and Derek welcomes the eliminated campers so they can choose who to root for. Tom, Nick, Dan, Jake, Ashley, Lill and Will support Miriam, while Gabby, Drew and Alec root for Ellie, and Grett is the only one who roots for Fiore. Trevor and Derek also welcome the patrons who supported the show, and inform the final three to choose a helper for the final challenge. Ellie chooses Gabby, Miriam chooses Tom, and Fiore is left with Grett as she promises to split the prize with her.

Trevor Explains the final challenge, which will be a Two-parter. In the first part, players must dive into a lake to look for a key, and they must run to the dining hall to open a chest the contains a map. Once they have their map, they must grab a shovel and run to the finish line. The first two campers to cross the finish line wins the first part, with third place being eliminated.

As the challenge begins, Miriam tells Fiore they have to work together to slow Ellie down, as she is the most athletic, and Grett offers to help. Meanwhile, Gabby expresses excitement to see Ellie again, and Ellie reciprocates while admitting that a lot had happened since Gabby left but manages to focus on the positives. They arrive at the lake and Ellie dives in. Once Fiore and Miriam arrive at the lake, Miriam tells Tom to get both her and Fiore's keys, and he dives in. Ellie swims up to the dock with her keys and runs off, but Grett trips Ellie, making her drop it. As she dives back in, Gabby chews Grett out and threatens her. Tom resurfaces with both keys and Fiore and Miriam leave as Ellie retrieves hers.

On the way to the dining hall, Miriam asks Tom how things are between him and Jake, and Tom admits he's still upset about what happened, so Miriam suggests he talk things out and not let their relationship end on a bitter note, but Fiore tells them to hurry up. Once at the dining hall, Fiore and Miriam get their maps, and Fiore swipes Miriam's before they leave.

Fiore discusses her plan with Grett; Fiore will go to hide her map and when she gets her shovel, she'll tell Miriam and Tom she lost it and tell them to get it while she goes to the finish line in case Ellie catches up. Grett agrees to lead them in the opposite direction.

Once Miriam and Fiore grab their shovels, Fiore executes her plan and tells them she lost her map and Grett has Miriam's. Tom wonder if they'll penalize her, and Fiore says she doesn't want to find out and goes to look for it, while Grett leads the two of them in the opposite direction, much to the spectators' chagrin.

Gabby warns Ellie of Grett's sabotage and Ellie grabs her shovel. Meanwhile, Miriam and Tom see Ellie and Gabby run past them, confusing the latter team are going in the wrong direction. Fiore then crosses the finish line first, causing Miriam and Tom to realize they were tricked again, and they run back, struggling to catch up to Ellie and Gabby. Suddenly, Miriam starts feeling tired and collapses, apparently having a heart attack. Tom is worried, and Ellie goes back to check on her. Tom runs off to call an ambulance while Ellie looks over Miriam, who tells her that... she can smell the million dollars, and throws Ellie's shovel away, surprising Tom as Gabby goes to get the shovel, but Miriam runs over to the finish line, earning her advancement to the second part of the challenge, to Ellie's exasperation.

With just Fiore and Miriam left in the game, Derek explains to them the second part of the challenge: they have to dig in the sand pit to find a gas canister, which they'll use to fill up a go-kart on the cliff and race to the finish line, and the first to cross wins the million dollars.

Fiore, Grett, Miriam and Tom dig in the sand pit, as Miriam tells Tom to keep an eye on Grett, while Fiore is unsure if she can overtake Miriam, so Grett tells Fiore she has a plan and runs off. On the cliff, Grett cuts the wires of the go-kart with the purple flag and pours soda in it, but unknown to her, Tom was watching her and switches the flags after she left.

Fiore finds the gas canister first and Grett tells her to use the go-kart with the teal flag, and Miriam finds her canister later. Fiore fills up her go-kart and drives past Miriam, who follows suit. Suddenly, Fiore's kart malfunctions and she complains to Grett. Fiore continues to drive slowly, as Miriam catches up and passes Fiore, whose kart breaks down. Fiore, not wanting to lose, pounds on the kart, which explodes and speeds into a tree, leaving Miriam the winner as no one offers to help Fiore.

At the bus stop, Miriam is given the million dollars before the police arrive to arrest Derek, Trevor and Jensen for wildlife damage, destruction of private property and illegal deforestation, to the horror of all, and Tom says they took their time getting here. Derek denies the claims, and Trevor asks the contestants to vouch for them, only to get no response. Derek then pulls a gun on the cops before Gabby attacks him. Trevor asks Miriam to bail them out, but she refuses, and Derek and Trevor are taken away.

Jensen arrives, punches a cop, steals the million dollars and drives off on the bus, but Tom goes after him with a grappling hook, and they struggle before the bus drives off the cliff and blows up, worrying the contestants.

Soon, a police car arrives with Tom in tow, as he managed to jump out of the bus before it went off the cliff. Miriam worries about her prize money, and Tom says he couldn't save it... but then reveals he did save it and gives it back to Miriam before letting the contestants know the police will pick them up after they hired him and thanking Gabby for the help. Tom then talks to Jake, saying he forgives him, acknowledging they both acted on impulse, and saying Jake helped him with his mistakes. Jakes asks if Tom would still talk to him, and Tom thinks they should spend some time apart to grow as people, as starting anything could ruin it. They hug before another bus comes to pick the campers up.

In one final scene, it's revealed that Kristal and Oliver were watching the footage together, and Oliver explains his shift on Season 1 ended before the last challenge, and that they never found Jensen's body. He then asks how the producers let Kristal run the show after that, and she explains she has connections. Kristal then feels relieved after watching Season 1, because now she and Oliver can begin the selection process for Disventure Camp: All-Stars.

Immunity Challenge

Challenge: Two-Part Final Challenge

Reward: $1,000,000.

Part 1:

Players must dive into a lake to look for a key. Once they have it, they must run to the dining hall where there will be a chest. Using the key from the lake, they must open it and retrieve a map. The players will use the map to find a location that's marked with a shovel. Once they grab the shovel, the players must use the map to get to the second marked location which is the finish line. The last person to cross will be eliminated, while the other two will move onto the next part of the challenge.

Winners

Fiore,Miriam

Part 2:

For the second part, the finalists will use their shovels from the previous part to dig in a sand pit. They will do this until they find a gas canister. Once they have their canisters, they'll have to climb to the top of a hill, put the gas in one of the go-karts, and drive to the finish line. The first one to cross the finish line will win the season.

Winner

Miriam

Trivia

General

The bottle of soda that Grett pours into the purple go-kart has the Odd Nation Cartoons' logo on it.

In one of her many confessionals in this episode, Fiore says that Grett is not receiving a penny of her money. This is a reference to the finale in the Beta version, where Fiore said the same thing in the confessional, although referring to Tom and Jake.

With the exception of Miriam, this finale is nearly identical to that of its beta counterpart, with the key differences being:

No final ceremony is held; instead, it's similar to that of the season 2 finale, with its three remaining finalists competing in a two-part final challenge to determine the winner.

Finalists are only permitted one helper each, as opposed to two helpers.

Grett's sabotage fails after Tom tampers with said sabotage, as opposed to the beta season, where it succeeded (or failed in its alternative ending).

The two finalists to advance to the challenge's second part are Fiore and Miriam, as opposed to its beta counterpart of Eli and Fiore participating in the finale.

This is the first and only episode to show two people in a confessional.

Fiore and Grett both state that they cannot swim.

Interestingly, in H2Oh-No!, Grett and Fiore are seen swimming just fine.

After Fiore's go-kart explodes and speeds into a tree, she mentions that she feels like she got ran over by a bus. This is a reference to Fiore's ending in the BETA, where she gets ran over by a bus trying to get her money back.

This is the last episode Dan, Drew, Lill, Nick and Will set foot on Camp Tipiskaw.

Excluding Personal Greetings, this is also currently the last time Dan, Drew and Lill are seen.

The confession that Miriam made after tricking Ellie that she was suffering from a heart attack is a reference to an identical quote made by Survivor contestant: Cirie Fields. In which she along with the other contestants in their alliance tricked fellow contestant Erik Reichenbach into giving up immunity and successfully voting him out.

The finalists are the highest ranking members of the merge; and interestingly enough, the helpers are all the lowest ranking members of the merge.

And the elimination order is similar;

Gabby-Grett-Tom

Ellie-Fiore-Miriam
